content:
When I'm in the middle of autocomplete for rw, I usually need to see what the theorems state while cycling though them. Is there a reliable way to do that?

Here's an example of the definitions not showing up in an expanded form:

Screenshot 2025-02-12 at 22.17.20.png

I remember that sometimes they do show up in a separate panel docked to the autocomplete but I can't spot the pattern for when they do and when they don't. And sometimes even the abbreviated version above doesn't show up.

This seems pretty critical to me so I'm confused that this part of the workflow seems shaky and unreliable. Am I doing something wrong?
You might also find the corresponding section in the Lean 4 VS Code extension manual helpful.
OMG ctrl+space does it. I'm used to it being the shortcut to bring up the completions themselves so it never occurred to me it also toggles something within.
Dan Abramov has marked this topic as resolved.
